main_definition: To give permission or consent to something; enable or make possible.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Permit someone to do or have something.
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher allowed the students to use calculators during the exam.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Make it possible for an event, action, or thing to happen.
meanings_and_examples.example: Rain will allow us to water our garden without using a hose.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Admit or accept the existence of something that is usually considered unpleasant or disagreeable.
meanings_and_examples.example: We have allowed ourselves to become complacent in our efforts to improve.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give up a claim, right, or possession willingly; abandon.
meanings_and_examples.example: He decided to allow his sister to keep the family car after graduation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To not restrict or limit something, often in comparison with what is possible or expected.
meanings_and_examples.example: The new software allows for greater flexibility than previous versions did.
